message.content:
cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CV. 

The paper introduces a toolkit for generating bag-of-words representations from multimodal input, which can be applied to various tasks such as speech-based emotion recognition and sentiment analysis in tweets. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including: 

- cs.CL (Computation and Language): This sub-category covers topics related to natural language processing, which is relevant to the text input feature supported by the openXBOW toolkit. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): This sub-category covers topics related to multimedia processing, which is relevant to the multimodal input feature supported by the openXBOW toolkit. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): This sub-category covers topics related to information retrieval, which is relevant to the bag-of-words representation used in the openXBOW toolkit. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category covers topics related to machine learning, which is relevant to the use of bag-of-words representations as features in various tasks. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): This sub-category covers topics related to computer vision, which could be relevant to the use of visual low-level descriptors as input features in the openXBOW toolkit.
